title: Sondra Rays Book Spiritual IntimacyWhat You Really Want with A Mate is a Practical Manual that Unlocks a Door for Deeper Sacred Experiences in All Your Relationships
text:
Recent release “Spiritual Intimacy – What You Really Want with A Mate” from Page Publishing author Sondra Ray is an example of what is possible in a relationship through a commitment to deep ease and freedom from conflict.
(PRWEB) October 12, 2015
Sondra Ray, first round Peace Corps volunteer in the Kennedy era, US Air Force Nurse during the Vietnam War, inspiring spiritual teacher loved the world over, devoted author of 20 books on healing, spiritual practices and relationships, has completed her newest work “Spiritual Intimacy – What You Really Want with A Mate”. She teams up with her twin flame, Markus Ray, to write this gripping and potent manual for better relationships. Together they guide their readers to gain real divine presence in their lives and awaken more awareness of immortal love in their hearts.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Sondra Ray’s practical metaphysical work takes the reader to a higher realm where spiritual intimacy, miracles and holy relationships can become actual in one’s life — an inspiring place of deeper sacred connection.
Sondra Ray works with clients worldwide helping them to achieve more loving and effective communication, deeper levels of intimacy in their relationships, and clarity on their greater spiritual purpose of life. She created the transformative “Loving Relationships Training” and has taught it worldwide for the past four decades. Her books, seminars and practice of Liberation Breathing® have helped thousands in the areas of healing, relationships, personal growth and self-development.
Readers who wish to experience this inspiring work can purchase “Spiritual Intimacy – What You Really Want with A Mate” at bookstores everywhere or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
Bookstores, Libraries, and Educational Organizations can order “Spiritual Intimacy” wholesale from Ingram Content Group at http://www.ingramcontent.com
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
